properties.name: Three Gorges Dam
properties.comment: The Three Gorges Dam is a hydroelectric dam that spans the Yangtze River by the town of Sandouping, located in Yiling District, Yichang, Hubei province, China. The Three Gorges Dam is the world's largest power station in terms of installed capacity (22,5

properties.name: Kariba Dam
properties.comment: The Kariba Dam is a hydroelectric dam in the Kariba Gorge of the Zambezi river basin between Zambia and Zimbabwe. It is one of the largest dams in the world, standing 128 m tall and 579 m long.

properties.name: Bratsk Hydroelectric Power Station
properties.comment: The Bratsk Hydroelectric Power Station is a concrete gravity dam on the Angara River and adjacent hydroelectric power station. It is the second level of the Angara River hydroelectric station cascade in Irkutsk Oblast, Russia.

properties.name: Aswan Dam
properties.comment: The Aswan Dam is an embankment dam situated across the Nile River in Aswan, Egypt. Since the 1960s, the name commonly refers to the High Dam. Construction of the High Dam became a key objective of the Egyptian Government following the Egyptian Revolution

properties.name: Akosombo Dam
properties.comment: The Akosombo Dam, also known as the Akosombo Hydroelectric Project, is a hydroelectric dam on the Volta River in southeastern Ghana in the Akosombo gorge and part of the Volta River Authority. The construction of the dam flooded part of the Volta River B

properties.name: Daniel-Johnson Dam
properties.comment: The Daniel-Johnson Dam, formerly known as Manic-5, is a multiple-arch buttress dam on the Manicouagan River that creates the annular Manicouagan Reservoir. The dam is composed of 14 buttresses and 13 arches and is 214 km (133 mi) north of Baie-

properties.name: Guri Dam
properties.comment: The Guri Dam is a concrete gravity and embankment dam in Bolívar State, Venezuela on the Caroni River. Its official name is Central Hidroeléctrica Simón Bolívar (previously named Central Hidroeléctrica Raúl Leoni from 1978 to 2000).

properties.name: W. A. C. Bennett Dam
properties.comment: The W. A. C. Bennett Dam is a large hydroelectric dam on the Peace River in northern British Columbia, Canada. At 183 m (660 ft) high, it is one of the world’s highest earth fill dams. Construction of the dam began in 1961 and culminated in 1968

properties.name: Krasnoyarsk Dam
properties.comment: The Krasnoyarsk Dam is a 124-metre (407 ft) high concrete gravity dam located on the Yenisey River about 30 kilometres (19 mi) upstream from Krasnoyarsk in Divnogorsk, Russia. It was constructed from 1956 to 1972.

properties.name: Zeya Dam
properties.comment: The Zeya Dam is a concrete gravity dam on the Zeya River, located by the town of Zeya, Amur Oblast, Russia, north of the Chinese border.

properties.name: Sanmenxia Dam
properties.comment: The Sanmenxia Dam is a concrete gravity dam on the middle-reaches of the Yellow River near Sanmenxia on the border Shanxi and Henan Province, China. The dam is multi-purpose and was constructed for flood and ice control along with irrigation, hydroelectr

properties.name: Robert-Bourassa generating station
properties.comment: The Robert-Bourassa generating station (formerly known as La Grande-2) is a hydroelectric power station on the La Grande River that is part of Hydro-Québec's James Bay Project in Canada.

properties.name: La Grande-3 generating station
properties.comment: The La Grande-3 or LG-3 is a hydroelectric dam on the La Grande River in northern Quebec, part of Hydro-Québec's James Bay Project.

properties.name: Ust-Ilimsk Hydroelectric Power Station
properties.comment: The Ust-Ilimsk Hydroelectric Power Station (Ust-Ilimsk HPS) is a concrete gravity dam on the Angara River and adjacent hydroelectric power station. It is located near Ust-Ilimsk, Irkutsk Oblast in Russia and is the third and last dam on the Angara cascad

properties.name: Boguchany Dam
properties.comment: The Boguchany Dam is a large hydroelectric dam on the Angara River in Kodinsk, Russia.

properties.name: Zhiguli Hydroelectric Station
properties.comment: The Zhiguli Hydroelectric Station or Zhigulyovskaya Hydroelectric Station, formerly known as Kuybyshev Hydroelectric Station is a large dam and hydroelectric station on the Volga River, located near Zhigulyovsk and Tolyatti in Samara Oblas

properties.name: Cahora Bassa Dam
properties.comment: The Cahora Bassa Dam is a dam in Mozambique. It is one of the three major dams on the Zambezi river system, the others being the Kariba and the Itezhi-Tezhi, the latter on the Kafue River, a tributary of the Zambezi.

properties.name: Serra da Mesa Dam
properties.comment: The Serra da Mesa Dam, once known as Sao Felix, is an embankment dam on the Tocantins River near Minaçu in Goiás, Brazil. The dam serves an associated hydroelectric power plant with a 1,275 MW installed capacity. The dam creates the largest reservoir b

properties.name: Brisay generating station
properties.comment: The Brisay hydroelectric power station is on the Caniapiscau Reservoir, in the Canadian province of Quebec. Part of Hydro-Québec's James Bay Project, the station can generate 469 MW and was commissioned in 1993. It generates electricity through the rese

properties.name: Bukhtarma Hydroelectric Power Plant
properties.comment: The Bukhtarma Hydroelectric Power Plant is a hydroelectric power plant on the Irtysh River 5 km upstream of the town of Serebryansk, in East Kazakhstan Province of Kazakhstan. "Bukhtarma" or "Buqtyrma" is a Kazakh word that can be translated

properties.name: Atatürk Dam
properties.comment: The Atatürk Dam, originally the Karababa Dam, is a zoned rock-fill dam with a central core on the Euphrates River on the border of Adıyaman Province and Şanlıurfa Province in the Southeastern Anatolia Region of Turkey. Built both to gener

properties.name: Irkutsk Hydroelectric Power Station
properties.comment: The Irkutsk Hydroelectric Power Station is an earthen embankment dam on the Angara River with an adjacent hydroelectric power station. It is located adjacent to Irkutsk, Irkutsk Oblast in Russiaand is the first dam on the Angara cascades. Con

properties.name: Tucuruí Dam
properties.comment: The Tucuruí Dam (Tucuruí means "grasshopper's water") is a concrete gravity dam on the Tocantins River located on the Tucuruí County in the State of Pará, Brazil.

properties.name: Nizhnekamsk Hydroelectric Station
properties.comment: The Nizhnekamsk Hydroelectric Station, also known as Lower Kama, is a dam and hydroelectric power station on the lower Kama River near Naberezhnye Chelny in Tatarstan, Russia.

properties.name: Hoover Dam
properties.comment: Hoover Dam, once known as Boulder Dam, is a concrete arch-gravity dam in the Black Canyon of the Colorado River, on the border between the US states of Arizona and Nevada. It was constructed between 1931 and 1936 during the Great Depression and was dedic

properties.name: Roseires Dam
properties.comment: The Roseires Dam is a dam on the Blue Nile at Ad Damazin, just upstream of the town of Er Roseires, in Sudan. It consists of a concrete buttress dam 1 km wide with a maximum height of 68 m, and an earth dam on either side. The earth dam on the

properties.name: Vilyuy Dam
properties.comment: The Vilyuy Dam is a large dam and hydroelectric power station on the Vilyuy River in Chernyshevsky, Sakha Republic, Russia. The dam was built between 1964 and 1967 to provide power for diamond mines in the area, and was the first such major struc

properties.name: Glen Canyon Dam
properties.comment: Glen Canyon Dam is a concrete arch dam on the Colorado River in northern Arizona in the United States, near the town of Page. The dam was built to provide hydroelectricity and flow regulation from the upper Colorado River Basin to the lower. Its reservoi

properties.name: Kenney Dam
properties.comment: The Kenney Dam is a rock-filled hydroelectric dam on the Nechako River in northwestern British Columbia, built in the early 1950s. The impoundment of water behind the dam forms the Nechako Reservoir, which is also commonly known as the Oosta Lak

properties.name: Sobradinho Dam
properties.comment: The Sobradinho Dam is a large hydroelectric dam built on the São Francisco River in Sobradinho, in the state of Bahia of Brazil. Completed in 1982, the dam generates power by utilizing six 175 MW Francis turbine-generators, totalling the inst

properties.name: Churchill Falls Generating Station
properties.comment: The Churchill Falls Generating Station is a hydroelectric power station located on the Churchill River in Newfoundland and Labrador. The underground power station can generate 5,428 MW, which makes it the second-largest in Canada, after the Robert-Bouras

properties.name: Nelson River Hydroelectric Project
properties.comment: The Nelson River Hydroelectric Project refers to the construction of a series of dams and hydroelectric power plants on the Nelson River in Northern Manitoba, Canada. The project began to take shape in the late 1950s, with the planning and construction o

properties.name: Keban Dam
properties.comment: The Keban Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Euphrates, located in the Elazıg Province of Turkey. The dam was the first and uppermost of several large-scale dams to be built on the Euphrates by Turkey.

properties.name: Volga Hydroelectric Station
properties.comment: The Volga Hydroelectric Station or Volga GES also known as the 22nd Congress of the CPSU Stalingrad/Volgograd Hydroelectric Power Station, is the largest hydroelectric station in Europe and is the last of the Volga-Kama Cascade of dams, before the

properties.name: Sayano–Shushenskaya Dam
properties.comment: The Sayano–Shushenskaya Dam is located on the Yenisei River, near Sayanogorsk in Khakassia, Russia. It is the largest power plant in Russia and the sixth-largest hydroelectric plant in the world, by average power generation.

properties.name: Garrison Dam
properties.comment: Garrison Dam is an earth-fill embankment dam on the Missouri River in central North Dakota. At over two miles (3 km) in length, it is the fifth-largest earthen dam in the world, constructed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers from 1947-53. The

properties.name: Kossou Dam
properties.comment: The Kossou Power Station is a hydroelectric power plant of the Bandama River in Côte d'Ivoire. It has a power generating capacity of 176 MW enough to power over 118,000 homes. The dam created the largest lake in Côte d'Ivoire, Lake Kossou.

properties.name: Iroquois Dam
properties.comment: The Iroquois Dam is a water reservoir located at Iroquois, Ontario, upstream of the power dam between Cornwall, Ontario, and Massena, New York. It regulates the outflow of water from Lake Ontario into the St. Lawrence Seaway.

properties.name: Oahe Dam
properties.comment: The Oahe Dam is a large dam along the Missouri River, just north of Pierre, South Dakota in the United States. It creates Lake Oahe, the fourth largest artificial reservoir in the United States, which stretches 231 miles (372 km) up the course of the Mis

properties.name: Itaipu Dam
properties.comment: The Itaipu Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Parana River located on the border between Brazil and Paraguay. The name "Itaipu" was taken from an isle that existed near the construction site. In the Guarani language, Itaipu means "the sounding

properties.name: Lagdo Reservoir
properties.comment: Lagdo Reservoir is a lake located in the Northern Province of Cameroon. The lake covers an area of 586 km².

properties.name: Lake Nzilo
properties.comment: Lake Nzilo (formerly Lake Delcommune, also Lac del Commune) is an artificial lake formed by a hydroelectric dam on the Lualaba River in the Katanga Province of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is about 10 miles (16 km) northeast of the major copp

properties.name: Gilgel Gibe I Power Station
properties.comment: The Gilgel Gibe I Power Station is a hydroelectric power plant of the Omo River in Ethiopia. It has a power generating capacity of 184 MW, enough to power over 123,200 homes.

properties.name: Gilgel Gibe III Dam
properties.comment: The Gilgel Gibe III Dam is an under construction 243 m high roller-compacted concrete dam with an associated hydroelectric power plant on the Omo river in Ethiopia. Once completed it would be the largest hydroelectric plant in Africa with a power output

properties.name: Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam
properties.comment: The Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam, formerly known as the Millennium Dam and sometimes referred to as Hidase Dam, is an under-construction gravity dam on the Blue Nile River in Ethiopia.

properties.name: Aswan Low Dam
properties.comment: The Aswan Low Dam or Old Aswan Dam is a gravity masonry buttress dam on the Nile River in Aswan, Egypt. The dam was built at the former first cataract of the Nile, and is located about 1000 km up-river and 690 km (direct distance) south-southeast of Cair

properties.name: Kpong Dam
properties.comment: The Kpong Dam is a hydroelectric power generating dam in Ghana completed in 1982. It has a capacity of 148 MW with all four units running, though the total nameplate capacity is 160 MW. It is owned and operated by Volta River Authority. The dam was intro

properties.name: Nairobi Dam
properties.comment: The Nairobi Dam is an embankment dam on the Nairobi River in Nairobi, Kenya.

properties.name: Katse Dam
properties.comment: The Katse Dam, a concrete arch dam on the Malibamat'so River in Lesotho, is Africa's second largest dam.

properties.name: Tekezé Dam
properties.comment: Tekezé Dam is a double-curvature arch dam in the Tigray region of northern Ethiopia on the Tekezé River, a Nile tributary that flows through one of the deepest canyons in the world. At the time of completion, the 188 metres (617 ft) high dam is said to

properties.name: Mohale Dam
properties.comment: Mohale Dam is a rock-fill dam in Lesotho. It is part of the Lesotho Highlands Water Project, which will eventually include 5 large dams in remote rural areas of Lesotho and South Africa.

properties.name: Mare aux Vacoas
properties.comment: Mare aux Vacoas is the largest reservoir in Mauritius. It is located in Plaines Wilhems, in the southwest of the island, to the south of the town of Curepipe.It has a capacity of 25.89 Mm3 and provide water to the upper Plaines Wilhems and to Moka.

properties.name: Allal al Fassi Dam
properties.comment: The Allal al Fassi Dam is an embankment dam located 18 km (11 mi) northeast of Sefrou on the Sebou River in the Fès-Boulemane region of Morocco. Completed in 1991, the dam provides water for irrigation and hydroelectric power production.

properties.name: Al Massira Dam
properties.comment: The Al Massira Dam is a gravity dam located 70 km (43 mi) south of Settat on the Oum Er-Rbia River in Settat Province, Morocco. Completed in 1979, the dam provides water for the irrigation of over 100,000 ha (247,105 acres) of farmland in the Doukkala re

properties.name: Al Wahda Dam
properties.comment: Al Wahda Dam, formerly known as M'Jaara Dam, is an embankment dam on the Ouergha River near M´Jaara in Sidi Kacem Province, Morocco. It was constructed for flood control, irrigation, water supply and hydroelectric power production. It is the second larg

properties.name: Bin el Ouidane Dam
properties.comment: The Bin el Ouidane Dam is an arch dam located 28 km (17 mi) south of Beni Mellal on the El Abid River in Azilal Province, Morocco. Constructed between 1949 and 1953, the purpose of the dam is hydroelectric power production and irrigation.

properties.name: Hassan I Dam
properties.comment: The Hassan I Dam is an embankment dam located 19 km (12 mi) northeast of Demnate on the Lakhdar River in Azilal Province, Morocco. Completed in 1986, the dam provides water for the irrigation of over 40,000 ha (98,842 acres) of farmland. The dam's hydroe

properties.name: Idriss I Dam
properties.comment: The Idriss I Dam, also known as the Idriss the First Dam, is a gravity dam on the Inaouen River, a tributary of the Sebou River. The dam is situated in the Gharb Basin and is located 27 km (17 mi) northeast of Fes in Taounate Province, Morocco

properties.name: Mohamed V Dam
properties.comment: The Mohamed V Dam is an arch-gravity dam located 35 km (22 mi) south of Zaio on the Moulouya River in Oujda-Angad Province, Morocco. The primary purpose of the dam is supplying water for the irrigation of 70,000 ha (172,974 acres) downstream.

properties.name: Massingir Dam
properties.comment: Massingir Dam is a dam on the Rio dos Elefantes (Olifants or Lepelle), Gaza Province, Mozambique. It is named after the town of Massingir, in Massingir District. The Shingwedzi River flows close to the northeastern side of the reservoir and joins the Rio

properties.name: Bakolori Dam
properties.comment: The Bakolori Dam is in Sokoto State in the Northwest of Nigeria, completed in 1978 and its reservoir filled by 1981. It is a major reservoir on the Sokoto River, a tributary of the Rima River, which in turn feeds the Niger River. Water from the dam suppl

properties.name: Challawa Gorge Dam
properties.comment: The Challawa Gorge Dam is in Karaye Local Government of Kano State in the Northeast of Nigeria, about 90 km southwest of Kano city. It is a major reservoir on the Challawa River, a tributary of the Kano River, which is the main tributary of the Hadejia R

properties.name: Dadin Kowa Dam
properties.comment: The Dadin Kowa Dam is in Yamaltu local government area of Gombe State in the north east of Nigeria. The dam is located about 35 kilometers to the east of Gombe town, and provides drinking water for the town. The dam was completed by the federal governmen

properties.name: Goronyo Dam
properties.comment: The Goronyo Dam impounds the Rima River in Goronyo local government area of Sokoto State in the north of Nigeria. It was completed in 1984 and commissioned in 1992. The dam is a sand-fill structure with a height of 21 m and a total length of 12.5 km

properties.name: Gusau Dam
properties.comment: The Gusau Dam holds a reservoir on the Sokoto River just upstream from Gusau, capital of Zamfara State in Nigeria. It supplies water to the city and neighboring communities. In 2006, the dam collapsed, killing 40 people and destroying 500 homes.

properties.name: Ikere Gorge Dam
properties.comment: The Ikere Gorge Dam is a major earth-fill dam in Iseyin local government area of Oyo State in the south west of Nigeria on the Ogun River. Reservoir capacity is 690 million m3.

properties.name: Jibiya Dam
properties.comment: The Jibiya Dam is in Jibiya local government area of Katsina State in the north of Nigeria. It is an earth-fill structure with a geomembrane liner, with a height of 23.5 m and a total length of 3,660 m, and has a capacity of 142 million m3. The dam was d

properties.name: Jebba Hydroelectric Power Station
properties.comment: The Jebba Power Station is a hydroelectric power plant of the Niger River in Nigeria. It has a power generating capacity of 540 MW enough to power over 364,000 homes The hydroelectric power plant was completed in 1984.

properties.name: Kafin Zaki Dam
properties.comment: The Kafin Zaki Dam is a controversial project to build a reservoir on the Jama'are River (also called the Bunga River in its upper reaches) in Bauchi State in the Northeast of Nigeria.

properties.name: Kainji Dam
properties.comment: Kainji Dam is a dam across the Niger River in western Nigeria. Construction of the dam began in 1964 and was completed in 1968. The total cost was estimated at US$209 million, with one-quarter of this amount used to resettle people displaced by the const

properties.name: Kiri Dam
properties.comment: The Kiri Dam is in Guyuk local government area of Adamawa State in the north east of Nigeria, damming the Gongola River. It is a 1.2 km long, 20 m high zoned embankment with an internal clay blanket.The dam was mainly completed in 1982.

properties.name: Obudu Dam
properties.comment: The Obudu Dam is in Obudu local government area of Cross River State in the south east of Nigeria. It is an earth-fill structure with a height of 15 m and a total crest length of 425 m, and has a capacity of 4.2 million m3. The dam is located wit

properties.name: Oyan River Dam
properties.comment: The Oyan River Dam is in Abeokuta North local government area of Ogun State in the West of Nigeria, about 20 km north west of the state capital Abeokuta. The dam crosses the Oyan River, a tributary of the Ogun River. It is used primarily to supply raw wa

properties.name: Shiroro Hydroelectric Power Station
properties.comment: The Shiroro Power Station is a hydroelectric power plant of the Kaduna River in Nigeria. It has a power generating capacity of 600 MW enough to power over 404,000 homes. The Shiroro Power Station began operating in 1990.

properties.name: Tiga Dam
properties.comment: The Tiga Dam is in Kano State in the Northeast of Nigeria, constructed in 1971-1974. It is a major reservoir on the Kano River, the main tributary of the Hadejia River

properties.name: Zobe Dam
properties.comment: The Zobe Dam is in Dutsin-Ma local government area of Katsina State in the north of Nigeria. It is an earth-fill structure with a height of 19 m and a total length of 2,750 m. The dam has a storage capacity of 179 Mca and irrigation potential of

properties.name: Kihansi Dam
properties.comment: Kihansi Dam is a hydroelectric dam located on the Kihansi River at the end of the Kihansi Gorge before the convergence with the Ulanga River in Tanzania approximately 450 km southwest of Dar Es Salaam.

properties.name: Mtera Dam
properties.comment: Mtera Dam is a hydroelectric dam in Tanzania. The dam is located midway between Iringa and Dodoma on the border between the Iringa Region and the Dodoma Region. The travel time from Dodoma is about three hours on a gravel road.

properties.name: Gileppe Dam
properties.comment: The Gileppe Dam is an arch-gravity dam on the Gileppe river in Jalhay, Liège province, Wallonia, Belgium. It was built in the 1870s to supply water for the wool industry in nearby Verviers.

properties.name: Kölnbrein Dam
properties.comment: The Kölnbrein Dam is an arch dam in the Hohe Tauern range within Carinthia, Austria. It was constructed between 1971 and 1979 and at 200 m (656 ft) high, it is the tallest dam in Austria.

properties.name: Batak Reservoir
properties.comment: The Batak Reservoir is located in the Rhodope Mountains and is the third largest in Bulgaria. It attracts many tourists and fishermen, and the resort Tsigov Chark was built on its shore.

properties.name: Belmeken Dam
properties.comment: The Belmeken dam is situated in the Rila Mountains and is the highest dam lake on the Balkan peninsula. There is a pumped-storage plant built on the lake (PSP). It is part of the cascade Belmeken-Chaira-Sestrimo.

properties.name: Dospat Reservoir
properties.comment: Dospat Reservoir is situated in the western part of the Rhodope Mountains, Bulgaria. The reservoir (formed by a dam in the town of Dospat, 82 km west of Smolyan) stretches nearly 19 km (12 mi) northwest to the city of Sarnitsa.

properties.name: Dushantsi Reservoir
properties.comment: The Dushantsi dam is settled in the Balkan Mountains, Bulgaria. The dam wall can be easily reached by car, driving along the old road to Burgas. The area around the dam is used for outgoings, picnics, water sports and fishing.

properties.name: Golyam Beglik
properties.comment: Golyam Beglik is a dam near the central parts of the Rhodope Mountains, Bulgaria. It was formerly officially called the Vasil Kolarov reservoir in honour of Vasil Kolarov, a communist political leader of the People's Republic of Bulgaria.

properties.name: Iskar Reservoir
properties.comment: The Iskar Reservoir is the largest reservoir in Bulgaria. It is situated on the Iskar River and provides 2/3 of the water for the capital Sofia, also being used for producing hydroelectricity.

properties.name: Ivaylovgrad Reservoir
properties.comment: The Ivailovgrad lake is one of the largest water reservoirs in Bulgaria. It is located in the eastern Rhodope Mountains. The area is rich in natural phenomenon of caverns and historical monuments, and offers nature lovers opportunities for water sports,

properties.name: Kardzhali Reservoir
properties.comment: The Kardzhali Reservoir is located near Kardzhali town in Kardzhali Province, Bulgaria. The reservoir was recently seeded artificially with European perch. The fish was taken from the Ovcharitsa reservoir.

properties.name: Koprinka Reservoir
properties.comment: Koprinka is a reservoir and dam in the Rose Valley, central Bulgaria. Its construction began after 1944 and was finished in 1956. It was built on the Tundzha river at 7 km to the west of the city of Kazanlak near the village of Koprinka. It is situ

properties.name: Lake Mandrensko
properties.comment: Lake Mandrensko or Lake Mandra is the southernmost of the Burgas Lakes, located in the immediate proximity of the Black Sea and close to Burgas. Being 8 km long and 1.3 km wide at maximum, as well as having an area of 38.84 km², it was a brack

properties.name: Ognyanovo Reservoir
properties.comment: Ognyanovo reservoir, also called Lake Ognyanovo, or Ognyanova, is a reservoir in Bulgaria near Sofia. Holding 32 million cubic metres of water, it is an important reservoir in Bulgaria. It impounds the waters of the Lesnovska river.

properties.name: Ogosta Reservoir
properties.comment: Ogosta is a lake in the North West of Bulgaria. It is the second largest artificial lake in Bulgaria and The Balkan Peninsula and one of the biggest in Europe. It collects the waters of the rivers Ogosta, Burzia and Zlatitsa and is located about

properties.name: Pasarel Reservoir
properties.comment: The Pasarel dam and reservoir is located 20 km to the southeast of Sofia, Bulgaria at an altitude of 700 m. The dam is situated roughly half way between the Iskar Reservoir and Lake Pancharevo near the village of Dolni Pasarel.

properties.name: Shiroka Polyana
properties.comment: Shiroka Polyana is a reservoir lake situated in the Western Rhodopes mountains in Bulgaria. The lake is situated 30 km south of Batak, on the road to Dospat. It is located 1500 meters above sea level amidst a forest of old pine trees.

properties.name: Studen Kladenets
properties.comment: The Studen Kladenets Reservoir is the second largest reservoir in Bulgaria. It is situated on the river Arda, and is created behind the Studen Kladenets dam, 30 km south-east of the town of Kardzhali. There are another two dams of the Arda - Kardz

properties.name: Ticha Reservoir
properties.comment: Ticha Reservoir is a reservoir in Varbitsa Municipality, Shumen Province, northeastern Bulgaria, located to the north and northeast of the town of Varbitsa. It is one of the largest lakes of Bulgaria. The Ticha Dam is located in the northeastern part

properties.name: Topolnitsa Reservoir
properties.comment: Topolnitsa is a reservoir in the Sredna Gora mountain, western Bulgaria. Its construction began in 1948 and was finished in 1963. It was built on the Topolnitsa river just south of the village of Muhovo. The main purpose of the Topolnitsa Dam is to

properties.name: Tsonevo Reservoir
properties.comment: Tsonevo Reservoir is a reservoir located in the valley of the Luda Kamchia River, 1 km from the village of Tsonevo. The reservoir ranks third in size in Bulgaria with water service of 17300 decameters. Its old name was Georgi Traikov. It has warm w

properties.name: Vacha Reservoir
properties.comment: Vacha Reservoir (before 1999: Antonivanovtsi Reservoir) is a body of water associated with a dam in Devin Municipality, south Bulgaria. It is part of the Vacha Cascade Joint Implementation Project involving three more dams and four power stations

properties.name: Yovkovtsi
properties.comment: The Yovkovtsi Reservoir is situated in northeastern Bulgaria, 5 kilometres away of the town of Elena. It was built 20 years ago on the Veselina River. The reservoir is located in the territory of Elena municipality, and supplies water to Veliko Tarn

properties.name: Kouris Dam
properties.comment: Kouris is the largest dam of a network of 107 dams in Cyprus. It lies at an altitude of 250 m and collects the water delivered by the rivers Kouris, Limnatis and Kryos. Furthermore, water from Diarizos river is diverted to Kouris dam via a 14.5 km

properties.name: Asprokremmos Dam
properties.comment: Asprokremmos dam is the second largest dam in Cyprus. It is built at an altitude of about 100 m above sea level and is located 16 km, (10 miles) east of the city of Pafos. Due to poor rainfall it is a rare event that the dam overflows. On 27th January

properties.name: Evretou Dam
properties.comment: Evretou Dam is the third largest dam in Cyprus and also the largest rock-fill dam on the island. It lies at an altitude of 165 m and is located about 15 km south of Polis Chrysochou, next to the abandoned village of Evretou. It is part of the C

properties.name: Lipno Dam
properties.comment: The Lipno Dam is a dam and hydroelectric plant constructed along the Vltava River in the Czech Republic.

properties.name: Orlík Dam
properties.comment: The Orlík Dam is the largest hydroelectric dam in the Czech Republic. It dams the Vltava River near the village of Solenice, which is near the town of Příbram. The structure is named after Orlík Castle, which is situated a few kilometers abov

properties.name: Nové Mlýny reservoirs
properties.comment: The Nové Mlýny reservoirs are three reservoirs behind the Nové Mlýny Dam on the Dyje River in the Czech Republic. The lower reservoir, 1668 ha in area, is the Novomlynska Reservoir, the middle reservoir, 1031 ha, is the Věstonice Reservoir a

properties.name: Slezská Harta Dam
properties.comment: Slezská Harta Dam is a water reservoir and dam in the Nízký Jeseník mountain range, Moravian-Silesian Region, Czech Republic. The dam is built on upper course of the Moravice River. With the surface of 8.7 km² it is one of the largest reserv

properties.name: Dalešice Dam
properties.comment: Dalešice Dam lies on the Jihlava River in the Czech Republic. It was built between 1970 and 1978 as a water source for the nearby Dukovany Nuclear Power Station. With nearby Mohelno Dam, it is part of the Dalešice pumped-storage plant.

properties.name: Šance Dam
properties.comment: Šance Dam also known as devils thumb, is a water reservoir and dam in the Moravian-Silesian Beskids mountain range, Moravian-Silesian Region, Czech Republic. The dam is built on upper course of the Ostravice River and has a surface of 3.37 km

properties.name: Těrlicko Dam
properties.comment: Těrlicko Dam is a water reservoir and dam in Těrlicko, Moravian-Silesian Region, Czech Republic. Its surface is 2.66 km², dam is built on a Stonávka River. It was constructed in 1955-1962.

properties.name: Brno Reservoir
properties.comment: The Brno Reservoir, previously known as the Kníničky Reservoir is a dam on the Svratka River right outside the city of Brno, Czech Republic. The construction of a levee on the 56th river kilometre of the Svratka River, together with flooding of

properties.name: Žermanice Dam
properties.comment: Žermanice Dam is a water reservoir and dam near Žermanice, Moravian-Silesian Region, Czech Republic. The dam is built on the Lučina River and has a surface of 2.48 km². It was constructed from 1951-1958.

properties.name: Seč Dam
properties.comment: Seč dam is an artificial drinking water reservoir located in Pardubice Region, Czech Republic. It supplies cities of Pardubice and Chrudim and is also an important tourist destination located in protected area Železné hory.

properties.name: Narva Reservoir
properties.comment: Narva Reservoir is a reservoir by Narva River, shared by Russia and Estonia. The reservoir was constructed during 1955-1956, during the Soviet times. It provides water to Narva Hydroelectric Station.

properties.name: Lake Kemijärvi
properties.comment: Kemijärvi is a lake in the town of Kemijärvi, Northern Finland.

properties.name: Lokka Reservoir
properties.comment: The Lokka Reservoir, is a reservoir, upstream of the Luiro River in Sodankylä, in northern Finland. Depending on the water level, its area ranges from 216 to 418 km². The corresponding water levels above mean sea level are 240–245 meters. The

properties.name: Eguzon Dam
properties.comment: The Eguzon dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Creuse River in central France. Construction took place from 1922 to 1926 and, at the time, was the largest dam in Europe.

properties.name: Étang de Soulcem
properties.comment: Étang de Soulcem is a large artificial lake in the Pyrenees mountains in Ariège, France. It is at an elevation of 1570 m and is used for hydroelectricity, generating 62 GWh/year. The lake, which has a surface area of 0.91 km², was formed following the

properties.name: Glanum Dam
properties.comment: The Glanum Dam, also known as the Vallon de Baume dam, was a Roman arch dam built to supply water to the Roman town of Glanum, the remains of which stand outside the town of Saint-Rémy-de-Provence in south-west France. It was situated south of Glanum, i

properties.name: Grand'Maison Dam
properties.comment: The Grand'Maison Dam is an embankment dam on L'Eau d'Olle, a tributary of the Romanche River. It is located in Vaujany of Isère within the French Alps. The primary purpose of the dam is to serve as the upper reservoir for a pumped-storage hydroelectric

properties.name: Lac de Vouglans
properties.comment: The Lac de Vouglans is the reservoir of the hydro-electric power station at Vouglans on the River Ain in the département of Jura in the region of Franche-Comté in eastern France.

properties.name: Malpasset dam
properties.comment: The Malpasset Dam was an arch dam on the Reyran River (fr), located approximately 7 km north of Fréjus on the French Riviera (Côte d'Azur), southern France, in the Var département. It collapsed on December 2, 1959, killing 423 people in the resulting

properties.name: Marèges Dam
properties.comment: The Marèges Dam is a concrete arch dam on the Dordogne River. It is located 4 km (2 mi) southeast of Liginiac in Corrèze department, France. It was constructed between 1932 and 1935 by the Railway Company du Midi. Its primary purpose is the generation

properties.name: Roselend Dam
properties.comment: The Roselend Dam is an arch-buttress dam located 5 km (3 mi) east of Beaufort in the Savoie department of the Rhône-Alpes region in south-eastern France. It is located just west and below the Cormet de Roselend mountain pass. The dam was designed by Coy

properties.name: Inguri Dam
properties.comment: The Inguri Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Inguri River in Georgia. Currently it is the world's second highest concrete arch dam with a height of 271.5 metres. It is located north of the town Jvari. It is part of the Inguri hydroelectric po

properties.name: Schluchsee
properties.comment: The Schluchsee is a reservoir lake in the district of Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald, southeast of the Titisee in the Black Forest near Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany.

properties.name: Großer Brombachsee
properties.comment: Großer Brombachsee is a reservoir in the Franconian Lake District.

properties.name: Forggensee
properties.comment: Forggensee is a lake located north of Füssen in the district of Ostallgäu in Bavaria, Germany. One of many lakes in the region around Hohenschwangau and Neuschwanstein castles, Forggensee is the fifth-largest lake in Bavaria, with a surface area of 15.

properties.name: Sylvenstein Dam
properties.comment: Sylvenstein Dam is an earthen embankment dam in the Isar valley, in the alpine part of Upper Bavaria, Germany which impounds the Sylvenstein Reservoir.

properties.name: Spremberg Dam
properties.comment: Spremberg Dam and its associated reservoir (Spremberger Stausee) lie between Cottbus and Spremberg and impound the River Spree. Together with the surrounding countryside they make up the protected landscape also known as the Talsperre Spremberg.

properties.name: Edersee
properties.comment: The Edersee is a 11.8 km² reservoir in Waldeck-Frankenberg, Hesse, Germany with 199.3 million m³ of storage space. It is the 2nd largest reservoir in terms of area, and the 3rd largest in terms of volume, in Germany. It is located on the Fulda Tributar

properties.name: Ecker Dam
properties.comment: The Ecker Dam is a dam near Bad Harzburg in the Harz mountains of Germany that went into service in 1942. It impounds primarily the waters of the river Ecker.

properties.name: Grane Dam
properties.comment: The Grane Dam is a dam above the village of Astfeld/Herzog-Juliushütte in the borough of Langelsheim in the Lower Saxon part of the Harz mountains.

properties.name: Innerste Dam
properties.comment: The Innerste Dam is a dam on the Innerste river, which lies near Langelsheim and Wolfshagen in the Harz mountains. It was built between 1963 and 1966 and belongs to the Harzwasserwerke. Its purposes are the supply of drinking water, flood pro

properties.name: Oder Dam
properties.comment: The Oder Dam is a dam in the Harz mountains of Germany. It lies above Bad Lauterberg in the district of Osterode am Harz in Lower Saxony and impounds the river Oder. The dam went into service in 1934 after taking 3 years to build.

properties.name: Oderteich
properties.comment: The Oderteich is an historic reservoir about seven kilometres northeast of Sankt Andreasberg in the Upper Harz in central Germany. It was built by miners from St. Andreasberg in the years 1715 to 1722 and, today, is an important component of the water su

properties.name: Oker Dam
properties.comment: The Oker Dam is a dam in the Harz mountains in Lower Saxony, Germany. It is fed by the River Oker.

properties.name: Söse Dam
properties.comment: The Söse Dam is a dam in the Lower Saxon part of the Harz mountains near Osterode in the German state of Lower Saxony. It was the first modern dam and reservoir complex to be built in the Harz and was constructed by the Harzwasserwerke between

properties.name: Wendebach Reservoir
properties.comment: Wendebach Reservoir is an artificial lake with a surrounding recreation park in the municipality of Gleichen and Friedland, Lower Saxony, Germany, about 8 km south of Göttingen. It is a popular summer outing goal for residents and students of Göttinge

properties.name: Biggesee
properties.comment: The Biggesee or Bigge Reservoir is a reservoir in Germany. It lies in the southern part of the Sauerland between Olpe and Attendorn.

properties.name: Eschbach Dam
properties.comment: The Eschbach Dam was the first dam to be built in Germany for drinking water supply. It is located in Remscheid, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. With its opening in 1891, this pioneer work of hydraulic engineering was a milestone in the economi

properties.name: Hengsteysee
properties.comment: The Hengsteysee (Lake Hengstey) is a reservoir on the Ruhr river between the cities of Hagen, Dortmund and Herdecke, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. It was built in 1929 and is one of five reservoirs on the Ruhr.

properties.name: Rur Dam
properties.comment: The Rur Dam is a 77.2 metre high dam located in the southwestern part of the state of North Rhine-Westphalia in Germany. It was built in 1939 and impounds the River Rur to form the Rur Reservoir (Rurstausee or Rursee) which is 7.83 km² in area.

properties.name: Möhne Reservoir
properties.comment: The Möhne Reservoir is an artificial lake in North Rhine-Westphalia, some 45 km east of Dortmund. The lake is formed by the damming of two rivers, Möhne and Heve, and with its four basins stores as much as 135 million cubic metres of water. The dam was

properties.name: Sorpe Dam
properties.comment: The Sorpe Dam is a dam near the small town of Sundern in the German district of Hochsauerland in North Rhine-Westphalia.

properties.name: Urft Dam
properties.comment: The Urft Dam is a 58.50 metre high dam in the southwestern part of the state of North Rhine-Westphalia in Germany. It was built in 1905. The dam impounds the River Urft in the district of Euskirchen to create the Urft Reservoir, 2.16 km² in area

properties.name: Bautzen Reservoir
properties.comment: The Bautzen Reservoir is a reservoir on the River Spree in Germany. It is situated just north of the city of Bautzen in the state of Saxony.

properties.name: Cranzahl Dam
properties.comment: Cranzahl Dam is a dam in the Free State of Saxony in East Germany. It was built from 1949 to 1952 near Sehmatal-Cranzahl and the Bärenstein mountain in the Ore Mountains to supply drinking water to Annaberg-Buchholz and the surrounding area.

properties.name: Eibenstock Dam
properties.comment: Eibenstock Dam is the largest dam in the Free State of Saxony in East Germany in terms of the height of the dam above the valley floor and its reservoir is the largest in volume. The dam impounds the waters of the Zwickauer Mulde and supplies drinki

properties.name: Einsiedel Dam
properties.comment: Einsiedel Dam is located in the German Free State of Saxony. Its reservoir supplies drinking water to Chemnitz and, in conjunction with the Central Ore Mountains reservoir system, that includes the reservoirs of Neunzehnhain I, II and Saidenbac

properties.name: Gottleuba Dam
properties.comment: The Gottleuba Dam is the second highest dam in Saxony, Germany. It serves as a reservoir for water supply for the town Pirna and provides flood protection, but energy production is small. The dam was built between 1965 and 1974. It is located at the nort

properties.name: Sosa Dam
properties.comment: The Sosa Dam is a dam in the Free State of Saxony in East Germany. It supplies drinking water to the Western Ore Mountains as well as acting as flood protection.

properties.name: Saidenbach Dam
properties.comment: The Saidenbach Dam is a dam in the German state of Saxony. Its reservoir supplies drinking water to Chemnitz and, in conjunction with the Central Ore Mountain Dam System and its other dams - Neunzehnhain I und II and Einsiedel - contributes t

properties.name: Kelbra Dam
properties.comment: The Kelbra Dam is a dam on the River Helme in the German state of Saxony-Anhalt. Behind the dam is the lake known as the Kelbra Reservoir or Kelbra Flood Retention Basin.

properties.name: Kiliansteich
properties.comment: The Kiliansteich is one of the oldest reservoirs in Germany. The reservoir is located near Straßberg (Harz) in the German state of Saxony-Anhalt and supplies drinking water.

properties.name: Königshütte Dam
properties.comment: The Königshütte Dam is a dam in the German state of Saxony-Anhalt in the Harz mountains. It impounds the River Bode and lies between Königshütte and Susenburg (both in the borough of Oberharz am Brocken).

properties.name: Mandelholz Dam
properties.comment: The Mandelholz Dam holds back the Kalte Bode Flood Control Basin which is a flood protection reservoir located between the villages of Elendand Königshütte near Wernigerode in the Harz mountains of Germany. It impounds the waters of the Kalte

properties.name: Rappbode Dam
properties.comment: The Rappbode Dam is the largest dam in the Harz region as well as the highest dam in Germany. Together with several other dams and retention basins, it forms the flood protection system for the eastern Harz.

properties.name: Rappbode Auxiliary Dam
properties.comment: The Rappbode Auxiliary Dam is one of the two auxiliary dams in the Rappbode Dam system. This is the heart of the Rappbode Dam system in the East Harz, which is operated by the Saxony-Anhalt Dam Company and which also includes the Hassel Auxiliary D

properties.name: Wendefurth Dam
properties.comment: The Wendefurth Dam near Wendefurth in the Harz is one of the dams downstream of the Rappbode Dam, that provides flood protection as well as impounding the River Bode to provide the lower reservoir for the Wendefurth Power Station. In additio

properties.name: Wippra Dam
properties.comment: The Wippra Dam or Wipper Dam is a dam on the river Wipper in the Harz mountains. It lies near Wippra, not far from Mansfeld and Hettstedt in Saxony-Anhalt. It was built between February 1951 and November 1952.

properties.name: Zillierbach Dam
properties.comment: The Zillierbach Dam lies in the East Harz in the German state of Saxony-Anhalt near the town of Elbingerode (Harz) and impounds the Zillierbach stream. It supplies drinking water to several villages in the High Harz (Elbingerode, Elend (Harz)

properties.name: Deesbach Forebay
properties.comment: The Inguri Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Inguri River in Georgia. Currently it is the world's second highest concrete arch dam with a height of 271.5 metres. It is located north of the town Jvari. It is part of the Inguri hydroelectric po

properties.name: Leibis-Lichte Dam
properties.comment: The Leibis-Lichte Dam is a 102.5-metre-tall dam in the German state of Thuringia in the Thuringian Highland. The dam was completed in 2005 to impound the River Lichte, between the Lichte municipality section Geiersthal and Unterweissbach.

properties.name: Neustadt Dam
properties.comment: The Neustadt Dam, also known as the Nordhausen Dam is the oldest dam in the Free State of Thuringia in Germany. It supplies drinking water to the town of Nordhausen. The dam is a curved gravity dam made of rubble stone based on the Intze Prin

properties.name: Lake Tisza
properties.comment: Lake Tisza, also known as Kisköre Reservoir, is the largest artificial lake in Hungary. It is located at the southeastern edge of Heves county, next to countiesBorsod-Abaúj-Zemplén, Hajdú-Bihar and Jász-Nagykun-Szolnok.

properties.name: Blöndulón
properties.comment: At 57 km², Blöndulón is one of Iceland's largest lakes. It was created in 1984-1991 as a reservoir for the Blönduvirkjun power plant, and has a greatest depth of 39 m. It is situated near Kjölur highland road in the Highlands of Iceland. The hot spr

properties.name: Kárahnjúkar Hydropower Plant
properties.comment: Kárahnjúkar Hydropower Plant is a hydroelectric power plant in eastern Iceland designed to produce 4,600 GWh annually for Alcoa's Fjardaál aluminum smelter 75 kilometres (47 mi) to the east in Reyðarfjörður. With the installed capacity of 690 MW, t

properties.name: Sigöldulón
properties.comment: The lake Sigöldulón is a reservoir in Iceland, also known as Krókslón. Situated in the south of the country, not far from Landmannalaugar, it is one of the country's 20 largest lakes at 14 km². Both the lake and the nearby power station tak

properties.name: Pórisvatn
properties.comment: Pórisvatn, is the largest lake of Iceland, situated at the south end of Sprengisandur highland road within the highlands of Iceland. It is a reservoir of a surface about 88 km² and uses the energy of the river Þjórsá, which comes down from the g

properties.name: Ardnacrusha power plant
properties.comment: Ardnacrusha power plant is a hydroelectric power station which was originally referred to as The Shannon Scheme. It is located near Ardnacrusha within County Clare approximately 1.5 miles (2.4 km) from the Limerick border. It is Ireland's largest river h

properties.name: Punt dal Gall Dam
properties.comment: Punt dal Gall is an arch dam located in Livigno valley, 10.5 km northwest of the Italian town of Livigno. It lies at the border between the Italian region of Lombardy and the Swiss canton of Grisons.

properties.name: Vajont Dam
properties.comment: The Vajont Dam is a disused dam, completed in 1959 in the valley of the Vajont River under Monte Toc, 100 km north of Venice, Italy. A 1963 (9 October) landslide caused the overtopping of the dam and around 2,000 deaths.

properties.name: Elektrėnai Reservoir
properties.comment: Elektrėnai Reservoir, located south of the city of Elektrėnai, Lithuania, is the third-biggest artificial lake in Lithuania. It was created in 1961 by damming the Strėva River. It supplies cooling water to the 1,800 MW Elektrėnai Power Plant.

properties.name: Kaunas Reservoir
properties.comment: Kaunas Reservoir is the largest Lithuanian artificial lake, created in 1959 by damming the Nemunas River near Kaunas and Rumšiškės. It occupies 63.5 square kilometers, which is about 0.1% of the total territory of Lithuania.

properties.name: Lkjelsvatneto
properties.comment: Løkjelsvatnet is a regulated lake in the municipality of Etne in Hordaland county, Norway. Water from the lake falls 400 vertical metres in tunnels and pipelines to Hardeland hydroelectric power station.

properties.name: Lake Solina
properties.comment: Lake Solina is an artificial lake in the Bieszczady Mountains region, more precisely in Lesko County of the Subcarpathian Voivodship of Poland. The lake was created in 1968 by the construction of the Solina Dam on the San River. It has an area o

properties.name: Włocławek Reservoir
properties.comment: Wloclawek Reservoir is a water body in the Middle Vistula flow, appeared in 1970 after building of the dam in Włocławek. The length of the reservoir is 58 km from Włocławek to Płock, average width is 1.2 km. It is biggest reservoir in P

properties.name: Lake Czorsztyn
properties.comment: Lake Czorsztyn is a man-made reservoir on the Dunajec river, southern Poland, between the Pieniny and the Gorce Mountains. It owes its existence to a dam, which is located in the village of Niedzica.

properties.name: Goczalkowice Reservoir
properties.comment: Goczalkowice Reservoir is an artificial water reservoir in the Silesian Voivodeship in Poland created with a dam on the Vistula in 1956. The area of the reservoir is 32 square kilometres and its capacity is 168 million m³. It is around 75 kilome

properties.name: Zalew Sulejowski
properties.comment: The Zalew Sulejowski is an artificial lake, a reservoir, in the Lodz Voivodeship built in the years 1969-1974 on the territories of three gmin: Tomaszów, Piotrków and Wolbórz. The aim of this reservoir was to supply a fresh drinking water to the

properties.name: Zegrze Reservoir
properties.comment: The Zegrze Reservoir is a man-made reservoir in Poland, located just north of Warsaw, on the lower course of the Narewriver. It is formed by a dam constructed in 1963 with a hydroelectric complex producing 20 Megawatts of energy.

properties.name: Alqueva Dam
properties.comment: The Alqueva Dam is an arch dam and the center-piece of the Alqueva Mutlipurpose Project. It impounds the River Guadiana, on the border of Beja and Évora Districts in south of Portugal. The dam takes its name from the town of Alqueva to its right bank. I

properties.name: Lake Izvorul Muntelui
properties.comment: The Lake Izvorul Muntelui, also known as Lake Bicaz, is the largest[1] artificial lake on the interior waters of Romania; it was created after the completion of a dam built on the Bistriţa River. The dam is located a few kilometers north of the town of

properties.name: Cerna River (Danube)
properties.comment: The Cerna is a river in Romania. The Cerna has its source on the south-east side of the Godeanu Mountains and flows into the Danube near the town Orșova. The upper reach of the river is sometimes called Cernișoara. With a basin of 1433 square km and a

properties.name: Frumoasa, Harghita
properties.comment: Frumoasa  is a commune in Harghita County, Romania. It lies in the Székely Land, an ethno-cultural region in eastern Transylvania.

properties.name: Iron Gates
properties.comment: The Iron Gates is a gorge on the River Danube. It forms part of the boundary between Romania and Serbia. In the broad sense it encompasses a route of 134 km (83 mi); in the narrow sense it only encompasses the last barrier on this route, just beyond the

properties.name: Râuşor
properties.comment: Rausor is a rock-fill water dam build in 1987 in the far north of Argeș County, Romania. It has a wall height of 120 m (390 ft) and a total volume of 60 million m³.

properties.name: Vidra Lake
properties.comment: Vidra Lake is a storage reservoir, located in the Parâng Mountains group, on the Lotru River, in Romania. It has an area of 12.40 km² and a volume of 340 million m³

properties.name: Lake Vidraru
properties.comment: Lake Vidraru is an artificial lake in Romania. It was created in 1965 by the construction of the Vidraru Dam on the Argeş River.

properties.name: Chirkey Dam
properties.comment: The Chirkey Dam is an arch dam on the Sulak River in Dagestan, Russia. The main purpose of the dam is hydroelectric power production and it supports a 1,000 MW power station. Construction on the dam began in 1964, the first generator was operati

properties.name: Chogray Reservoir
properties.comment: The Chogray Reservoir is an artificial reservoir on the East Manych River on the border of Stavropol Krai and Kalmykia in southern Russia. The reservoir, 49 km long, was constructed in 1969-1973, primarily to satisfy the demands of local irrigate

properties.name: Gorky Reservoir
properties.comment: Gorky Reservoir is an artificial lake in the central part of the Volga River formed by a hydroelectric dam of Gorky Hydroelectric Station built in 1955 between the towns of Gorodets and Zavolzhye and filled in 1955 – 1957. It spans for 430

properties.name: Ivankovo Reservoir
properties.comment: Ivankovo Reservoir or Ivankovskoye Reservoir, informally known as the Moscow Sea, is the uppermost reservoir on theVolga River, in Moscow and Tver Oblasts of Russia, located some 130 km north of Moscow. The dam of the reservoir is situated in

properties.name: Kama Reservoir
properties.comment: The Kama Reservoir, also known as the Perm Reservoir, is a reservoir formed by the dam of the Kama Hydroelectric Station near Perm (constructed in 1954-1956). The Kama Reservoir has a surface area of 1,915 km² and a water volume of 12,2 cubic

properties.name: Kuybyshev Reservoir
properties.comment: Kuybyshev Reservoir or Kuybyshevskoye Reservoir, sometimes called Samara Reservoir and informally called Kuybyshev Sea, is a reservoir of the middle Volga and lower Kama in the Chuvash Republic, Mari El Republic, Republic of Tatarstan, Sam

properties.name: Nizhnekamsk Reservoir
properties.comment: Lower Kama Reservoir or Nizhnekamsk Reservoir is the lowest reservoir from the Kama Riverhydroelectric cascade. It is situated in Tatarstan, Udmurtia, Bashkortostan and Perm Krai, Russian Federation. The reservoir was filled in 1978-81 up to 62

properties.name: Rybinsk Reservoir
properties.comment: Rybinsk Reservoir, informally called the Rybinsk Sea, is a water reservoir on the Volga River and itstributaries Sheksna and Mologa, formed by Rybinsk Hydroelectric Station dam, located on the territories of Tver, Vologda, and Yaroslavl Obla

properties.name: Saratov Reservoir
properties.comment: Saratov Reservoir is an artificial lake in the lower part of the Volga River in Russia formed by the dam of the Saratov Hydroelectric Station situated in the city of Balakovo. Filling of the reservoir started in 1967. The uppermost point of the

properties.name: Sheksna Reservoir
properties.comment: The Sheknsna Reservoir or the Sheksninskoe Reservoir is a water reservoir on Sheksna River and Lake Beloye, in Belozersky, Vashkinsky, Kirillovsky, andSheksninsky Districts of Vologda Oblast in Russia. The reservoir is formed by the dam of t

properties.name: Tsimlyansk Reservoir
properties.comment: Tsimlyansk Reservoir or Tsimlyanskoye Reservoir is an artificial lake on the Don River in the territories of Rostov and Volgograd Oblasts. Completed in 1952, the reservoir is one of the largest in Russia, providing power and irrigation to th

properties.name: Uglich Reservoir
properties.comment: Uglich Reservoir or Uglichskoye Reservoir is an artificial lake in the upper part of the Volga River formed by the Uglich Hydroelectric Station dam. It was built in 1939 in the town of Uglich. It is located in Tver and Yaroslavl Oblasts in centra

properties.name: Votkinsk Reservoir
properties.comment: The Votkinsk Reservoir, is a reservoir formed by the dam of the Votkinsk Hydroelectric Station on the Kama River in Perm Krai and Udmurtia, Russia. The reservoir filling took place in 1962-1964. The Votkinsk Reservoir has a surface area of 1

properties.name: Orava (reservoir)

properties.name: Flevoland

properties.name: San Roque Dam

properties.name: Bureya Dam

properties.comment: Yonki Dam is an earth-fill embankment dam over the Ramu River that supports the Ramu 1 hydroelectric power plant and the (under construction) Yonki Toe of Dam power plant.

properties.name: Alicurá Dam
properties.comment: The Alicurá Dam is the first of five dams on the Limay River in northwestern Argentine Patagonia (the Comahue region), about 100 km from the city of San Carlos de Bariloche and 705 m above mean sea level. It was inaugurated in 1985.

properties.name: El Cajón Dam
properties.comment: The El Cajón Dam is a dam in Córdoba, Argentina, near Capilla del Monte. It is built on the course of the Dolores River, at about 910 m MSL. The wall of the dam is 39 m tall, and creates a reservoir with a surface area of 1.45–1.8 km2.

properties.name: El Chocón Dam
properties.comment: The El Chocón Dam is the fourth of the five dams on the Limay River in the northwestern Argentine Patagonia (the Comahue region), 381 m above mean sea level. El Chocón is on the Limay River at about 80 km (50 mi) upstream of its confluence

properties.name: Piedra del Águila Dam
properties.comment: The Piedra del Águila Dam is the second of five dams on the Limay River in northwestern Argentine Patagonia (the Comahue region) and 590 m above mean sea level, downstream from the confluence of the Limay and the Collón Curá River. It was

properties.name: Salto Grande Dam
properties.comment: The Salto Grande Dam is a large hydroelectric dam on the Uruguay River, located between Concordia, Argentina, and Salto, Uruguay; thus is shared between the two countries.

properties.name: San Roque Lake
properties.comment: The San Roque Lake is a reservoir (artificial lake) in the province of Córdoba, Argentina. It was created by the damming of several rivers, especially the Suquía and the Cosquín. It is located next to the city of Villa Carlos Paz, about 600 m above me

properties.name: Yacyretá Dam
properties.comment: The Yacyretá Dam is a dam and hydroelectric power plant built over the waterfalls of Jasyretâ-Apipé in the Paraná River, between the Argentine Province of Corrientes and the Paraguayan City of Ayolas. The dam is named for Yacyretâ Island

properties.name: Balbina Dam
properties.comment: The Balbina Dam is a hydroelectric dam and power station on the Uatumã River in the Amazon Rainforest, Brazil. The location is under the municipality of Presidente Figueiredo jurisdiction, in the state of Amazonas.

properties.name: Furnas Dam

properties.name: Guarapiranga
properties.comment: The Reservoir of Guarapiranga (Represa de Guarapiranga) is a reservoir in the southern area of the city of São Paulo, in the State of São Paulo, Brazil.

properties.name: Eng Sérgio Motta Dam
properties.comment: The Engineer Sérgio Motta Dam, formerly known as the Porto Primavera Dam, is an embankment dam on the Paraná River near Rosana in São Paulo, Brazil. It was constructed between 1980 and 1999 for hydroelectric power production, flood control and navigat

properties.name: Santo Antônio Dam
properties.comment: The Santo Antônio Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Madeira River 6 km (4 mi) southwest of Porto Velho in the state of Rondônia, Brazil. The dam's run-of-the-river hydroelectric power station will have 44 turbines each rated at 71.6 MW resulting in a t

properties.name: Três Marias Dam
properties.comment: The Três Marias Dam, also known as Bernardo Mascarenhas, is an embankment dam on the São Francisco River near Três Marias in Minas Gerais, Brazil. It was constructed for hydroelectric power production and flood control. The dam was comple

properties.name: Embalse Recoleta
properties.comment: Embalse Recoleta is a reservoir located 16 km northeast of the city of Ovalle, in the Coquimbo Region, Chile.

properties.name: Embalse La Paloma

properties.name: Lake Rapel
properties.comment: Lake Rapel is an artificial lake created by a dam on the Rapel River. It is located in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region, Central Chile. The reservoir was created with the aim of feeding the Rapel Hydroelectric Plant.

properties.name: Colbún Lake
properties.comment: Colbún Lake is a reservoir in the Maule Region in Chile, straddling the provinces of Talca (comuna of San Clemente) and Linares (comuna de Colbún). Located 48 km southeast of the city of Talca, the regional capital and 35 km northeast of

properties.name: Laguna del Maule
properties.comment: Laguna del Maule is a lake located in the Andes of Central Chile. The lake is natural in origin but its water level was raised by a dam inaugurated in 1957. It has a capacity of 1,420 million m³.

properties.name: Laja Lake
properties.comment: Laguna del Laja is a lake located in the Bío-Bío Region of Chile. The lake borders and gives its name to Laguna del Laja National Park.

properties.name: Dez Dam
properties.comment: The Dez Dam is a large hydroelectric dam built in Iran in 1963 by an Italian consortium.

properties.name: Karun-4 Dam
properties.comment: The Karun-4 Dam is an arch dam on the Karun River in the province of Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari, Iran. The Karun has the highest discharge of Iran's rivers. The objectives of the construction of Karun-4 dam and hydroelectric power plant are elec

properties.name: Karkheh Dam
properties.comment: The Karkheh Dam is a large multi-purpose earthen embankment dam built in Iran on the Karkheh River in 2001 by the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC).

properties.name: Khoda Afarin Dam
properties.comment: Khoda Afarin Dam is an earth-fill embankment dam on the Aras River straddling the border between Iran and Azerbaijan. It is located 8 km (5 mi) west ofKhomarlu in East Azerbaijan Province, Iran and 14 km (9 mi) southwest of Soltanlı in J

properties.name: Darbandikhan Dam
properties.comment: The Darbandikhan Dam is a multi-purpose embankment dam on the Diyala River in northern As Sulaymaniyah Governorate, Iraq. It was constructed between 1956 and 1961. The purpose of the dam is irrigation, flood control, hydroelectric power produc

properties.name: Diyala Weir
properties.comment: Diyala Weir is a diversion dam on the Diyala River 90 km northeast of Baghdad, Iraq. The main purpose of the dam is to divert outflow of the Hemrin Dam (11 km upstream) on the Diyala River to the Khalis and Sadr Al-Mushtarak canals for irrigation.

properties.name: Dukan Dam

properties.name: Hemrin Dam

properties.name: Mosul Dam

properties.name: Samarra Barrage

properties.name: Fallujah Barrage

properties.name: Haditha Dam

properties.name: Kurobe Dam
properties.comment: The Kurobe Dam, is a variable-radius arch dam on the Kurobe River in Toyama Prefecture on the island of Honshū, Japan. It supports the 335 MW Kurobe No. 4 Hydropower Plant and is owned by Kansai Electric Power Company. At 186 metres (610 ft)

properties.name: Cirata Dam

properties.name: Jatiluhur Dam
properties.comment: The Jatiluhur Dam is a multi-purpose embankment dam on the Citarum River in West Java, Indonesia. It is located 70 km (43 mi) east of Jakarta, close to the medium-size town of Purwakarta.

properties.name: Saguling Dam
properties.comment: The Saguling Dam is an embankment dam on the headwater of Citarum River in West Java, Indonesia. It is located 26 km (16 mi) west of Bandung. Construction began in 1983. The reservoir had filled by 1985 and the first generator was operational in 1986.

properties.name: Band-e Amir National Park
properties.comment: Band-e Amir National Park Persian: Afganistan's first national park, located in the Bamyan Province. It is a series of six deep blue lakes separated by natural dams made of travertine, a mineral deposit.

properties.name: Kajaki Dam

properties.name: Band-e Sardeh Dam

properties.name: Kaptai Dam

properties.name: High Island Reservoir

properties.name: Aberdeen Reservoirs

properties.name: Shek Pik Reservoir

properties.name: Almatti Dam
properties.comment: The Almatti Dam is a dam project on the Krishna River in North Karnataka, India which was completed in July 2005. The target annual electric output of the dam is 560 MU (or GWh).

properties.name: Maithon Dam

properties.name: Malampuzha Dam

properties.name: Parambikulam Dam

properties.name: Mula Dam

properties.name: Laxiwa Dam

properties.name: Dworshak Dam

properties.name: Revelstoke Dam
